what is the command you are using to mount it?
sudo mount -t smbfs //192.168.1.118/Linux/ /home/downloads/windows/ -o username=sofus,password=
sudo mount -t smbfs //192.168.1.118/Linux /home/downloads/windows -o uid=1000,gid=100
That did it! Mind explaining what the error was?
also you should be using cifs instead of smbfs.
that just specified your user uid=1000 and group users by the gid=100
